title: Kawdana East Grama Niladhari Division
text:
Kawdana East Grama Niladhari Division is a <a href="Grama%20Niladhari">Grama Niladhari</a> Division of the <a href="Dehiwala%20Divisional%20Secretariat">Dehiwala Divisional Secretariat</a> of <a href="Colombo%20District">Colombo District</a> of <a href="Western%20Province%2C%20Sri%20Lanka">Western Province, Sri Lanka</a> . It has Grama Niladhari Division Code 539/42B.
Lotus Grove are located within, nearby or associated with Kawdana East.
Kawdana East is a surrounded by the <a href="Karagampitiya%20Grama%20Niladhari%20Division">Karagampitiya</a>, <a href="Udyanaya%20Grama%20Niladhari%20Division">Udyanaya</a>, <a href="Bellanvila%20Grama%20Niladhari%20Division">Bellanvila</a>, <a href="Attidiya%20North%20Grama%20Niladhari%20Division">Attidiya North</a>, <a href="Katukurunduwatta%20Grama%20Niladhari%20Division">Katukurunduwatta</a>, <a href="Kawdana%20West%20Grama%20Niladhari%20Division">Kawdana West</a> and <a href="Nedimala%20Grama%20Niladhari%20Division">Nedimala</a> Grama Niladhari Divisions.
Demographics.
Ethnicity.
The Kawdana East Grama Niladhari Division has a <a href="Sinhalese%20people">Sinhalese</a> majority (74.6%) and a significant <a href="Sri%20Lankan%20Moors">Moor</a> population (15.4%) . In comparison, the <a href="Dehiwala%20Divisional%20Secretariat">Dehiwala Divisional Secretariat</a> (which contains the Kawdana East Grama Niladhari Division) has a <a href="Sinhalese%20people">Sinhalese</a> majority (60.5%), a significant <a href="Sri%20Lankan%20Moors">Moor</a> population (20.8%) and a significant <a href="Sri%20Lankan%20Tamils">Sri Lankan Tamil</a> population (14.5%) 
Religion.
The Kawdana East Grama Niladhari Division has a <a href="Buddhism%20in%20Sri%20Lanka">Buddhist</a> majority (66.1%) and a significant <a href="Islam%20in%20Sri%20Lanka">Muslim</a> population (16.1%) . In comparison, the <a href="Dehiwala%20Divisional%20Secretariat">Dehiwala Divisional Secretariat</a> (which contains the Kawdana East Grama Niladhari Division) has a <a href="Buddhism%20in%20Sri%20Lanka">Buddhist</a> majority (54.3%), a significant <a href="Islam%20in%20Sri%20Lanka">Muslim</a> population (22.6%) and a significant <a href="Hinduism%20in%20Sri%20Lanka">Hindu</a> population (12.1%)
